programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Steve Irwins family at Australia Zoo. Robert takes on the challenge of relocating Bosco, the zoos most aggressive crocodile. Terri helps Harley the koala find love after a tough breeding season

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game Warden Albert Flores enforces fishing laws, staking out illegal night shrimpers. Warden Jayme Deschaaf ensures dove hunters follow the migratory bird laws

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and the team are on a time limit to treat an English bulldog who swallowed a rock. Hector gets a workout from some puppies in need

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff tries to mend a German shepherds broken elbow for its war veteran owner, and a cat with a swollen bladder needs difficult surgery to save its life

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia looks back at the highlights of season four. Also featuring a look behind the scenes, and updates on the dogs featured this season

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Day-to-day life in a pitbull rescue centre. Tia gets a devastating injury, so her kids keep Villalobos running. An elusive dog needs catching in the middle of the night

programme.title: Pet Nation Renovation
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes, Dave Salmoni follows the renovation of Michigan Animal Rescue League, to transform the pet shelter and improve the animals quality of life

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: Staff feel the pressure as a century-old Galapagos tortoise undergoes surgery. And, an orphan koala bear gets a special birthday surprise.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: A couple dreams of a treehouse that will recapture mountain vistas, so Pete Nelson creates a bungalow with large windows to take in a view that was once lost

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: Chris experiences his first rescue and saves two goats in serious need of medical attention. Joey the calf recovers from a series of surgeries

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How male humpback whales can sing for several days with no vocal cords - and why they do it in the first place. Plus, how anteaters are able to eat so quickly

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The programme examines how ostriches can run so fast, dogs ability to pick up scents underwater, and how and why fireflies glow

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: In one of his most exciting expeditions to date, biologist Forrest Galante travels to the remote Galapagos Islands in search of the fabled Fernandina tortoise

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Peaches, a two-month-old warthog, charms his keepers while training to become an animal ambassador. Willow, a red panda, shows signs of being pregnant

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Renowned bear handler Jeff Watson sets out on an adventure to teach his two 700lb grizzly bears, Bob and Screech, how to survive on their own in the wild

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.sub-title: To Teach a Bear to Fish
programme.desc: Jeff Watson tries to teach his rescued grizzly bears Bob and Screech how to fish - but it proves more difficult than imagined and he appears to be falling behind

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The family join a competitive pheasant hunt ahead of Thanksgiving. Elsewhere, Billy and Ami surprise the siblings with new additions to the homestead

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 November 1998. Featuring Culture Club, The Beautiful South, Lynden David Hall, The Cardigans, U2, Kele Le Roc, Alanis Morissette and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 6 November 1998. Featuring Alanis Morissette, Billie Piper, Aerosmith, Touch and Go, Pras, Another Level, M People and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Kid Jensen looks at the weekly pop chart from November 24 1977 and introduces the Carvells, Bonnie Tyler, Hot Chocolate, Darts, Leo Sayer, Santa Esmerelda, Abba, Wings, the Bee Gees and a Legs and Co dance sequence to Jonathan Richman

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Tommy Vance present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 22 November 1984. Featuring Nick Heyward, The Human League, Billy Ocean, Murray Head, Shakin Stevens and Chaka Khan.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bjork and Jack Dee introduce the biggest-selling songs of 1995, plus the Christmas Day Number One - Michael Jacksons Earth Song. Featuring performances by N-Trance, Annie Lennox, Take That, Boyzone, the Outhere Brothers, Simply Red, Robson and Jerome, Pulp and Blur

programme.title: Country Music Association Awards 2025
programme.desc: Highlights of the 59th Country Music Association Awards show, from Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, US. American singer-songwriter Lainey Wilson is the 2025 host

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: The American blues singer performs in concert at Stoke Newington Town Hall in north London, featuring tracks from across her career, spanning from the self-titled 1971 debut album to her April 2012 release, Slipstream. The set includes her signature tunes, Love Has No Pride, Nick of Time, and Love Me Like a Man. She is joined on stage by regular collaborator Paul Brady

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: A memorable edition of the iconic 1970s music series, introduced by Whispering Bob Harris and featuring a concert performance by American blues singer, guitarist, songwriter and activist Bonnie Raitt. First shown in March 1976

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Bjork and Jack Dee introduce the biggest-selling songs of 1995, plus the Christmas Day Number One - Michael Jacksons Earth Song. Featuring performances by N-Trance, Annie Lennox, Take That, Boyzone, the Outhere Brothers, Simply Red, Robson and Jerome, Pulp and Blur

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 November 1998. Featuring Culture Club, The Beautiful South, Lynden David Hall, The Cardigans, U2, Kele Le Roc, Alanis Morissette and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 6 November 1998. Featuring Alanis Morissette, Billie Piper, Aerosmith, Touch and Go, Pras, Another Level, M People and Cher

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Kid Jensen looks at the weekly pop chart from November 24 1977 and introduces the Carvells, Bonnie Tyler, Hot Chocolate, Darts, Leo Sayer, Santa Esmerelda, Abba, Wings, the Bee Gees and a Legs and Co dance sequence to Jonathan Richman

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Seema Jaswal presents coverage of the evening session on day one at York Barbican, featuring two first-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. Three-time champion Ding Junhui edged past Robert Milkins 6-5 in last years corresponding session. In the other match, qualifier David Gilbert made six half-century breaks as he defeated 16th seed Xiao Guodong 6-4. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor, Stephen Hendry and Kyren Wilson, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: The vets have their work cut out after a herd of dairy farm cows becomes seriously ill, and Tristans metal detector proves surprisingly useful. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tristan takes a shine to the owner of a shy tortoise, and Mrs Donovans home-made animal remedies cause more problems than they cure. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James treats a dog with a confusing complaint, Siegfried tries a herbal remedy on a sick sheep, and Tristan heads off to London for the Coronation. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: Michael Palin, Kate Adie and Ricky Gervais
programme.desc: King of chat Michael Parkinson welcomes funnyman and explorer Michael Palin, who talks about his expedition across the Sahara Desert. He also talks to veteran BBC news correspondent Kate Adie, discussing her distinguished career, and actor-comedian Ricky Gervais, who reveals the inspiration for David Brent, his obnoxious character in award-winning sitcom The Office. Plus, music by singing sensation Norah Jones. From 2002

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: Being the Brontës
programme.desc: Martha Kearney is joined by author Helen Oyeyemi and journalist Lucy Mangan to immerse themselves in the lives of Charlotte, Emily and Anne Brontë to discover the inspiration behind their classic novels Jane Eyre, Wuthering Heights and Agnes Grey. Travelling to the Haworth Parsonage in West Yorkshire, the trio discover how just two years before their most famous novels were published in 1847, the sisters prospects were bleak. Charlotte was in love with a married man, their clergyman father Patrick was going blind, and their brother, Branwell, was battling alcoholism. However, by 1848, Charlotte, Emily and Anne were literary sensations, and Martha, Helen and Lucy immerse themselves in the personal lives of the sisters to find out how this happened

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Matt Allwright and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Fake Michael Jackson Brought Bailiffs to My Door
programme.desc: A man whose home address was hijacked by a fraudster using the name Michael Jackson who received traffic fines and a visit from a bailiff and now says the authorities wont help. Plus, how a leading airlines loyalty points scheme is being targeted by thieves. To round off BBC Scam Safe week, Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin and Gloria Hunniford revisit some of its biggest scam stories to look at how criminals tactics have evolved over the years

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin feels like he has a mountain to climb in Blackpool at a mid-terrace with potential subsidence. Hes also in Leicester, grappling with a non-standard construction property. Martin Roberts is in Somerset where he meets a mother-and-daughter team on a mission to create a dream home from a somewhat smelly cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams of sisters search for money-making items at an antiques fair in Llandeilo, Carmarthenshire, with the help of mentors Izzie Balmer and Richard Madley. Presenter Roo Irvine monitors proceedings and also quizzes fairgoers about the identity of a mystery rotating wooden object with holes and a handle

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a classic car is stolen from a local showroom, it looks like a disgruntled employee has taken his revenge after being sacked. The cops soon discover that bodybuilder Aaron has been displaying aggressive behaviour and suspicions are raised that he has been taking steroids, possibly supplied by Donals secret girlfriend Sasha. Brandi thinks Clint should tell Nicole hes lost £25,000, but Clint is hoping hell get the cash back before she finds out

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton meets a couple who have spent the last six years travelling the globe and have their entire belongings in two rucksacks. With £325,000 to hand, the pair have decided they need a base in the Wiltshire countryside, and Alistair is the man to show them what this gorgeous county has to offer. He also meets an intensive care nurse at her much-loved and fruitful allotment

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: A masked Mexican wrestler delivers a championship belt from his sport for the buyers to consider. A penny-farthing bicycle is also presented, thought it is probably more of a prop than a viable method of transport. Other items include a vintage harmonium, miniature garden and an art deco lamp. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: A Rock n Roll Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhursts road trip rolls into Glasgow, Tashs hame toon. Tim banks on a thoroughly Scottish piece of pottery and hopes a seafaring find will float the bidders boat. Tashs eclectic haul features a tribute to a famous naval hero, a spooky skull and a very cheeky bathing beauty thats sure to raise eyebrows in the saleroom

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Anita Rani

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: Illegal Blood Sports and Tractor Sabotage
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, farmer Helen Smith has endured years of intimidation from illegal off-road bikers tearing across her land. Now, with her elderly mother living in fear after shots were fired at their home, police are determined to track down the gang behind the violence. In Hampshire, officers pursue men suspected of terrorising wildlife and wrecking farmland by taking part in the illegal blood sport of hare coursing. Plus, reporter Paul Colgan discovers how farmers in the Scottish Highlands doubling as on-call firefighters are using cutting-edge technology to protect their rural communities

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: When some of Colins friends visit from England to relive their legendary Dolphin Cove backpacking holiday, one of them wakes up to find a strangers corpse in his locked motel room, with no sign of how the killer got out. While Colin is revisiting history with an old crush, Mack and Glenn take increasingly desperate steps to extinguish their growing fire. Drama, starring Anna Samson and Lloyd Griffith

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guests hosts, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Bella Hull joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Tim McGarry, Colin Murphy, Diona Doherty and Neil Delamere are joined by guest Milton Jones for the panel show taking a sideways look at the weeks news. Comedy asides and good craic abound as they turn their wit and satirical spin on the people and events who are making the news in Northern Ireland and beyond

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by eight-time Oscar-nominee Glenn Close, who is joining the cast of Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery. Also on the sofa are Emmy-winning Swedish star Alexander Skarsgard, who is playing a biker in British love story Pillion, actress and national treasure Miriam Margolyes, discussing her anthology The Little Book of Miriam, and Bridgerton star Nicola Coughlan, who is taking to the National Theatre stage. Plus, Jessie J performs HAPPY from her album Dont Tease Me with a Good Time

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens as they write and perform a show-stopping original song. As ever, its a family line-up for the finale, with Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton forming the judging panel, and last years winner and reigning champion, Kyran Thrax, dropping in along with the seasons eliminated queens

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. The contestants are siblings Jack and Hannah from Aberdare and Cardiff, mother and daughter Jacqui and Lola from Stockport, and friends Mel and Liz from Sydenham and High Wycombe

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Jamie Oliver and Georgina Hayden, and guest Bob Mortimer. Olly Smith picks the drinks, and Remi Idowu gives a cookie masterclass

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Gardening expert Alan Titchmarsh invites Mary Berry for a special look behind the walls of his garden, where the pair cook and watch snippets of Marys old TV shows. Together, they make cauliflower soup, smoked salmon, asparagus and dill spaghetti, teriyaki tuna with ribbon salad, and apple cake served with cream

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: A look ahead to the weekends matches, including Manchester City v Leeds United, Everton v Newcastle United and Chelsea v Arsenal in the Premier League

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of the afternoon session on day one from York Barbican, featuring two first-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. Ronnie OSullivans defence of the title came to an early end at this stage last year when Barry Hawkins came back from 4-2 down to overcome him 6-4. There was also a 6-5 victory for Shaun Murphy against Zhao Xintong. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor, Stephen Hendry and Kyren Wilson, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. This episodes contenders are three couples from Bedfordshire, Grimsby, and Dunfermline

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: After the excitement of Blackpool, the couples are back in the studio, where its business as usual as they perform another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke. Adding to the fun, they also face a new challenge in which they must perform a second dance, unaware of the style until a few seconds before they set foot on the ballroom floor. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman have the details

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. Advising the contestants are Rachel Riley, Ellie Simmonds, Richard Madeley, David Walliams, Adam Hills, Fatiha El-Ghorri, Vogue Williams and Spencer Matthews

programme.title: Wild Cherry
programme.sub-title: This Town Is Turning Me Crazy
programme.desc: Lorna fights to get Grace back into school, whilst news of explicit photos on the internet shocks the community. Allegra tries to help Grace, but her plan backfires. The parents have a showdown at a wild party hosted by Gigi where dark forces are at play, and tragedy strikes Richford Lake

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Leeds United at Etihad Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Fulham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The Citizens will have been expecting three points at home to Leeds as their title challenge continued. Spurs were held to a 1-1 draw at home to Fulham last term, with Tom Cairney equalising for the Cottagers and also getting sent off. Plus, Brentford v Burnley, Sunderland v Bournemouth and Everton v Newcastle United

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers has a conversation with former Manchester United striker and manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer

programme.title: The Impossible
programme.desc: A British family spends Christmas in Thailand, only to get caught up in the 2004 tsunami. While his mother lies injured in hospital, the eldest son ventures into the ensuing chaos to search for his father and younger brothers, whom he was separated from during the crisis. Drama, with Naomi Watts, Ewan McGregor and Tom Holland

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Artists Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo are the guides for a journey through the Renaissance, one of historys most creative, and sometimes weirdest, periods

programme.title: Dolittle
programme.desc: In Victorian era Britain, Dr John Dolittle is a Welsh vet with the ability to communicate with animals. After his wife, Lily, dies at sea, he retreats from society and only tends to animals. However, he is eventually drawn into a mission to save the Queens life. Fantasy adventure, starring Robert Downey Jr, Antonio Banderas and Michael Sheen, while Emma Thompson, Rami Malek and Tom Holland lend their voices to some of the creatures

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Rachel attempts to help Amy get a job with an old friend from school, and Paul ropes Sam into filming content for his new YouTube fitness channel. Alison Steadman, Katherine Parkinson, Jim Howick, Tom Basden, Freya Parks and Tori Allen-Martin star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams travel through the breathtaking beauty of Costa Rica, a country that contains five per cent of the worlds biodiversity, before reaching Panama, the seventh country of the race. The next checkpoint is Bocas del Toro, an archipelago off Panamas Caribbean coast

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: The Aussie version of the hit game show continues. When David takes on Brianas dream to be sole Survivor, hes not worrying about the consequences - until he throws his strongest relationship into the line of fire. Will Sam stay loyal to the back-stabbing David or play her own game, eliminating him just like her Blood did on the other tribe?

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: Building relationships is an important strategy to get to the end. However, when Sam must choose between getting out a threat and friend or the recently turned enemy, she must do whats best for her end-game. Whether it is the right decision remains to be seen

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar tries to understand what drives people to trade and uncovers a link between an established financial brand with offices in the City of London and the case of Gurvin

programme.title: Scam Land: Money, Mayhem and Maseratis
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar gets closer to Gurvin and a meeting with a whistleblower raises questions about marketing and responsibility in the multi-billion-pound world of retail forex trading

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Longing for her old life, Gemma tries reliving a past night out, only to realise she has changed for ever and misses Sadie. Malcolm assumes babysitting duties, only to find his evening upturned by Derek, who ropes the grandfather into helping him exact revenge on his ex-wife. In an attempt to support his friend, while keeping Sadie safe from all perceived threats, Malcolm panics when Gemma announces she is coming home early. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the Tardis destroyed and the Doctor gone, there is only one person who can stop the whole universe collapsing - a scared girl who still believes in stars. Finale of Matt Smith and Karen Gillans first run as the Doctor and Amy Pond, with Alex Kingston returning as River Song

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor checks in to a time travelling hotel in future London, and quickly discovers a sinister plot is afoot. Following the clue through a succession of eras, he discovers that the fate of the universe revolves around an ordinary woman seeking solitude at Christmas. Nicola Coughlan guest stars with Ncuti Gatwa in the 2024 Christmas special

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Palmeiras v Flamengo (Kick-off 9.00pm). All the action from the all-Brazilian showpiece match in the South American equivalent to the UEFA Champions League, held at Estadio Monumental U in Lima, Peru. Palmeiras last won this competition in 2021 and reached the final in dramatic fashion, overturning a 3-0 first leg deficit against LDU Quito by winning 4-0 in front of their own fans. Flamengo are looking to regain the trophy they lifted in 2022 and they edged past Racing 1-0 on aggregate in the last four

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. Nessa has taken up residence in Daves caravan in Sully and is getting ready for Neils christening. The event means a big reunion for the gang, at which Smithy receives surprising news from Nessa, and Stacey has a special request for her husband

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessas plans to let Smithy see the baby, while Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise as she tries to find a new job. Meanwhile, Dawn and Pete join Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night. Comedy, starring Joanna Page and Mathew Horne

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens as they write and perform a show-stopping original song. As ever, its a family line-up for the finale, with Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton forming the judging panel, and last years winner and reigning champion, Kyran Thrax, dropping in along with the seasons eliminated queens

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: The devilish doings Down Under continue with Sophie feeling betrayed by her former Blood tribe - and looking to get her revenge - and Sandra feeling proud of her move to Water.

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: Sophie knows that she has a target on her back and needs to shift it off of her, and Sandra reflects on her Day 16 curse

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Very average woman Spud cooks, cleans, serves and cares for her father. The only problem is she does it all rather badly - and half-heartedly. A woman who is never seen, unattractive and ignored, she does not feel bad about herself. However, when her father dies, she starts to realise she may have to come out from the shadow and be seen. Comedy drama, written by and starring Siobhán McSweeney

programme.desc: Bebe advises Frasier to feign illness to secure a pay rise and prove he is indispensable, but the station responds by cleaning out his cubicle and auditioning for a replacement. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Harriet Sansom Harris

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers buy into a restaurant, but their conflicting views on everything leave them without a head chef on opening night - and most of the waiters also walk out. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.desc: A chance to see a live performance recorded at Blackpools historic Grand Theatre, on what was the final night of the comedians sell-out, 158-date UK and Ireland tour. Here, Jon takes to the stage to comment - and generally complain - on topics including parenthood, Brexit and haircuts. The question of why nobody but him can correctly load a dishwasher is also raised. Alas, Jon can offer no solutions to all the problems he identifies, but nevertheless provides plenty of mirth as he fails to reach a viable conclusion to his grouses

programme.desc: The Foxhall Village Guest House in Blackpool is this weeks second venue, where the food falls short of expectations and not everyone has a good nights sleep

programme.desc: Mike and Sue Brierley welcome their rivals to Gables Pod Camping in Escomb in County Durham. After dramatic discoveries and frank exchanges, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: In Waterbeach, Cambridgshire, Amber and Martin Brammah needed help with their three-bed semi. Amber, who owns her own fitness company and runs classes from home, was firmly Team List It. She wanted a bigger, brighter space for her clients and a more family-friendly layout in the rest of the house. Principal ecologist Martin was very much Team Love It. He liked his five-minute commute to work and believed that Kirstie could formulate a plan to transform their home. In one of the most turbulent builds ever, did Kirstie pull it out of the bag?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer take two couples house-hunting in south Wales. Chris and Laura want a slice of the countryside with dreams of a vegetable patch in a huge garden for their one-year-old son Jack to play in but when the perfect place arises reality brings them down from cloud nine. Bob and Lara want a three-to-four bed family home in the city and parking is a must but Phil struggles to tick all the boxes in the competitive Cardiff housing market where theyve already been outbid 10 times

programme.title: New Zealands Best Homes with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: Phil tours a clifftop masterpiece with breathtaking harbour views, a beautiful family home in Remuera and a Queenstown mountain retreat with an edge. All three homes have family at their core, built to adapt alongside lifes seasons, whether thats with all the kids and grandchildren at home, or if its just mum or dad

programme.title: Secrets of the Christmas Market
programme.desc: Now in its 20th year, Belfasts much-loved festive market is set to be bigger than ever, and a team of 50 people has just two weeks to transform the empty grounds of Belfast City Hall into a spectacular winter wonderland. Market boss Allan, in his last year before retirement, is eager to make this the best market yet, as stallholders from 30 different countries join local traders to create and sell everything from hand-made trinkets to religious artefacts, to pancakes so good that they cause queues around the block. This documentary looks behind the scenes, meeting some of the people who bring Christmas to life at one of the UKs most popular events

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Alpine Train at Christmas
programme.desc: A festive ride on the illustrious Bernina Express, one of the most picturesque trains in the world, beginning in Chur, the oldest town in Switzerland, and travelling through the Alpine landscape to the town of Tirano in Italy. Along the way, the train visits the Morteratsch Glacier, the Landwasser Viaduct and Lago Bianco, meeting people who live and work in the area including an artisan cheese-maker, a creator of traditional Christmas toys and a multi-generational musical farming family. Narrated by Hugh Bonneville

programme.title: Sandi Toksvigs Great Riviera Rail Trip

She starts with a rail journey from Marseille to St Tropez. She taps into her inner Viking with a spot of sailing, hits the beach that launched a sexual revolution in the 1960s, and helps out in the vineyard with one of Provences biodynamic winemakers

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In this special Christmas episode, the volunteer lifeboat crew at Clovelly prepare their villages decorations, including a mile of lights from top to bottom of the village, and a Christmas tree made from ocean rubbish that washed up on the seashore. Further inland, it is festive full steam ahead for the volunteers on the Dartmouth Steam Railway, who are busy transforming a locomotive and 10 carriages into a steam train of over 50,000 lights, while a farmer at St Mabyn is busy working on mulled cider

programme.desc: For those who like to shop at high-end department stores, this documentary investigates whether they should stick with premium products from Fortnum and Mason this Christmas or if they can get deluxe for less at German discounter Lidl. The programmes reveal this years Christmas products from both retailers, including Fortnum and Masons luxury hampers and gifts from Lidls middle aisle, while seasonal treats including smoked salmon, Christmas pudding and port also go head to head in a series of taste tests. Theres also a look at how Fawlty Towers became a huge hit, and how a real-life love affair inspired Carla Lane to write suburban sitcom Butterflies. programme.title: Royal Palaces at Christmas
programme.desc: Stories about the royal family during the festive season, from dancer Wayne Sleep revealing he was smuggled into Kensington Palace to give Princess Diana private lessons to a pub landlord who had Elizabeth II as a customer after she was stranded by a snowstorm. There is the tale of how Sandringham became a Christmas palace thanks to a wayward Prince of Wales needing a country home for feasting and entertaining, and how Elizabeth II would travel to Norfolk for Christmas by commuter train

programme.title: Secrets of the Royals: Births, Marriages and Deaths
programme.desc: A look at the wedding of Princess Elizabeth and Prince Philip in 1947, which lifted spirits in bleak post-war Britain, with historian Lisa Hilton delving into the royal archives to dig out the wedding menu. Biographers Andrew Morton and Andrew Lownie take viewers through the birth and christening of the Duke and Duchess of Sussexs son Prince Archie, while Kate Williams examines the life of Mary, Queen of Scots

programme.title: William: When He Becomes King
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how Prince William may shape and redefine the monarchy when he is eventually crowned king. programme.title: The Most Embarrassing TV Moments

From the world of weather forecasting is Michael Fishs infamous denial of an imminent hurricane, and the time This Morning presenter Alison Hammond pushed a sailor into the drink off the floating weather map. programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over 2021s biggest Christmas TV shows. Theyll be passing comment on the most talked about hits from the festive season, including Michael McIntyres Christmas Wheel, First Dates at Christmas, Strictly the Real Full Monty, Jamie: Together at Christmas, Love Actually, Worlds Strongest Man, I Can See Your Voice Christmas Special, The Repair Shop at Christmas, Elves, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, and No Time to Die

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Rosaria bought Bella Luna to realise her son Gianfrancos ambition to become a chef, but the Italian restaurants future looks bleak due to his lack of experience in the kitchen combined with her refusal to acknowledge the eaterys many flaws. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster

programme.desc: A hitman linked to a drugs gang guns down two men in a supermarket car park. Later, a teenage dare leads to a massive rescue operation after a boy vanishes in the water

programme.desc: A territorial battle develops in the corridors of power. Sir Humphrey has skilfully moved the PMs political adviser Dorothy Wainwright out of her office - but she insists on moving back. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: The government faces financial ruin, but that does not seem to worry Sir Humphrey, who goes to extreme lengths to get his latest pay rise scheme approved. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim has his first encounter with the Foreign Office and discovers they are something of a law unto themselves. He learns they are keeping reports of a communist coup secret and refusing to vote as he wishes in a UN debate on the Middle East. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker runs the risk of upsetting the Church of England by recommending one of two rather dubious characters for a new bishop. Meanwhile, Humphrey has his own reasons for wanting a third. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: MI5 reveals its former head was a double agent who worked as a Russian spy. To make matters worse, he had been investigated and given security clearance by Sir Humphrey. Classic satire, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the Norfolk village of Cley next the Sea and finds that due to Dutch settlers in the Elizabethan era, its not as next the sea as it once was. Ben talks to historian Onyeka Nubia, who reveals that the village was part of a cosmopolitan community that introduced Britain to the canary and even the beer people drink today

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the worlds caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the worlds highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolias Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colonys nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim tries to censor part of a publication by the former prime minister that portrays him in a bad light. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim tries to turn the tables on French officials over the Channel Tunnel borders. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim gets wind of a major financial scandal in the City that is bound to have damaging repercussions for the government. With the party conference looming, he decides its time for him to take swift and firm action - but Sir Humphrey has other ideas. Political comedy first broadcast in 1987, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim feels local government isnt really representative, so is eager to hear more about proposals to reform the system. Sir Humphrey fears this would lead to the civil service losing its power and turns to an unlikely ally to help persuade the prime minister to think again. Political comedy first broadcast in 1988, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is left with egg on his face when Sir Humphrey makes it known the Government plans to cut arts funding. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim decides to save money by getting rid of the Department of Education, much to the disgust of Sir Humphrey. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of seafarers tries to save a derelict Victorian pier from demolition by getting it registered as a vessel. Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Irene Browne, Maurice Denham and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: Yesterdays Enemy
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Vernes novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: A recently divorced bookshop owner finds love with a glamorous Hollywood film star, but ends up the focus of unwanted media interest - which makes maintaining a relationship a tricky proposition. Romantic comedy written by Richard Curtis, starring Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Rhys Ifans, Emma Chambers, James Dreyfus and Gina McKee

programme.title: Nobody
programme.desc: A quiet and unassuming family man slowly reveals his true character after his house is burgled by two petty thieves. The aftermath of the incident ignites his long-simmering rage, triggering dormant instincts and propelling him on a brutal path that brings to the surface dark secrets and lethal skills. Crime drama, starring Bob Odenkirk, Connie Nielsen and Aleksey Serebryakov

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorcycle stuntman Johnny Blaze sells his soul to diabolical Mephistopheles to save the life of his father. His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: When Cpt Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Fantasy adventure based on the video game, starring Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa and Ron Perlman

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: The Northman Interview Special
programme.desc: Alexander Skarsgard, Anya Taylor-Joy and director Robert Eggers talk about making their Viking adventure

programme.title: Home Alone 3
programme.desc: Cheeky eight-year-old Alex Pruitt is delighted to be given a remote-controlled toy car by his neighbour - unaware it contains a stolen microchip. A gang of crooks heads to Alexs town with the intention of recovering the valuable item, but the resourceful youngster has prepared for their arrival with a series of nasty booby-traps. Comedy sequel, starring Alex D Linz, Olek Krupa, Rya Kihlstedt and Lenny von Dohlen

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wifes place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporations staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia

programme.title: Apocalypse Now: Final Cut
programme.desc: An army captain is sent on a top-secret mission into Cambodia, where his goal is to find and assassinate a renegade colonel who has gone insane and is worshipped by his followers as a god. However, as his patrol boat journeys further upriver, the conflict and disarray surrounding him becomes increasingly disturbing and nightmarish. Extended version of Francis Ford Coppolas acclaimed Vietnam War drama - re-edited in 2019 by the director himself to mark the films 40th anniversary. Starring Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando and Robert Duvall

programme.desc: As war is raging across 18th-century colonial America, a band of famed native fighters join British forces for an assault on a French stronghold. Western, originally filmed in 3-D, starring George Montgomery and Joan Vohs

programme.desc: Blue kills the son of a military officer who was attacking a girl. The Cannons try to find the girl so she can tell her side of the story before he is hanged for murder

programme.desc: Blue and the son of the local Apache chief vie for a wild black stallion. The fight threatens to spill over into a war with the tribe, but the Chief allows Blue to keep the horse. However, when the son steals the horse, the problem resurfaces. Western drama, starring Mark Slade, Leif Erickson and Cameron Mitchell

programme.title: The Persuaders!
programme.desc: A photographer assists Brett and Danny in smuggling an American gangster out of Italy so he can testify against a large crime syndicate. Guest starring Joan Collins

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed recuperates in a private hospital after breaking his leg, unaware an old enemy whom he sent to prison is plotting to murder him. Patrick Macnee and Linda Thorson star, with Ray Brooks

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: A new experimental growth drug developed to end world hunger is accidentally leaked into the sewer system, leading to an epidemic of giant rats. Espionage adventure with Patrick Macnee

programme.title: Air America
programme.desc: A reckless traffic reporter for a radio station loses his helicopter pilots licence, but is recruited by the CIA into a secret organisation transporting cargo and troops around Southeast Asia during the Vietnam War. However, he not only discovers his superiors are involved in smuggling drugs, but his co-pilot also has an illicit sideline of his own. Comedy adventure, with Mel Gibson, Robert Downey Jr, Nancy Travis, Burt Kwouk and Ken Jenkins

programme.title: American Heist
programme.desc: A man with a shady past is planning to start his own business, but is drawn back into the criminal underworld when his brother is released from prison. The ex-convict has a dangerous plan for an elaborate bank robbery, and family loyalty drives his brother to get involved. Crime drama, starring Adrien Brody, Hayden Christensen and Jordana Brewster

They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Fords Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret

programme.title: 100 Rifles
programme.desc: A gunrunner flees across Mexico to escape the authorities, and succumbs to the charms of female guerrilla leader who is determined to avenge past injustices. Western, starring Burt Reynolds, Raquel Welch, Fernando Lamas and Dan OHerlihy

programme.title: Winchester 73
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his fathers killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally

programme.title: Bandolero!
programme.desc: An outlaw due to be hanged is rescued at the last minute by his brother, and together they go on the run with a hostage, hotly pursued by the local sheriff. As the fugitives contemplate giving up a life of crime, they face a dangerous run-in with a gang of Mexican bandits. Western, starring James Stewart, Dean Martin, Raquel Welch and George Kennedy

programme.desc: Hannah, a bakery owner living in small-town Minnesota, is shocked to discover her delivery driver has been shot dead in the alley behind her shop. The local police quickly prove they are ill-equipped to handle a full-scale murder inquiry, and call for back-up from an equally ineffectual city cop. Unimpressed by the response from the professionals, Hannah takes matters into her own hands and turns amateur sleuth to solve the crime herself. Mystery, starring Alison Sweeney

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the opening stages of the Tour de France are relocated to Ireland. Belgian Dom Chabol has been one of the best support riders for 20 years, a sacrificial role with victory never an option. programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham residents raise money for a statue to commemorate fishermen lost at sea, but Pat Seddons plan to support the cause by participating in a fundraising skydive worries her friends and relatives. Jan Hart goes trawling for scallops, and shares some ancient superstitions

programme.title: Succession
programme.desc: The Roys gather for a family therapy session. Kendall finds his sobriety tested. Shiv considers joining the team of a divisive candidate

programme.title: Succession
programme.desc: Tom has a bachelor party to remember. Kendall and Roman eye new business opportunities

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony organises a poker game, but is forced to turn on an old friend who loses but is unable to pay his debts. Janice urges Richie to plot against the Mafia boss, while Junior lets his nephew in on a few family secrets. Frank Sinatra Jr guest stars

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Anthony Jr outrages his parents, while Christopher succumbs to the allure of Hollywood and falls for an attractive film executive. Fantasy drama, starring Kit Harington, Stephen Dillane, Maisie Williams and Emilia Clarke

programme.title: Game of Thrones

Starring Kit Harington, Emilia Clarke, Lena Headey and Stephen Dillane

programme.title: Succession

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: AJ is inconsolable after his split from Blanca and is prescribed antidepressants by his therapist, but Tony offers his own brand of medicine by sending his son to a strip club. Gritty drama, starring James Gandolfini

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: As Ruggieri continues his investigation, both Genny and the Levantes try to secure control of Secondigliano. In Italian

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: The Levante and O Galantommo team up against Genny, who is ready to counter. Meanwhile, Ciro lets it be known that hes back. In Italian

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: While Daenerys meets her future, Bran meets the past. Elsewhere, Tommen confronts the High Sparrow, and Arya continues her training. Starring Emilia Clarke, Maisie Williams and Isaac Hempstead-Wright

programme.desc: The fantasy drama continues as Tyrion strikes a deal, while Jorah and Daario undertake a difficult task as they seek to catch up with Daenerys. Back across the Narrow Sea, Jaime and Cersei try to improve their situation. Starring Peter Dinklage, Iain Glen, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Lena Headey

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britains grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard, the owners of Carlton Towers near Selby in North Yorkshire, prepare to host a fitness boot camp weekend at their property - while also welcoming an array of guests to celebrate their sons birthday. Meanwhile, Sir Benjamin Slade hopes a murder mystery weekend at Maunsel House in Somerset will help pay off a sizeable electricity bill

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixhams annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham relives its glory days by hosting a vintage ships race and heritage festival, and a local toy-shop owner faces a difficult decision

Fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Peter Dinklage and Emilia Clarke

Tyrion arrives in a new location and is presented with a fresh opportunity and Daenerys grapples with the politics of power in Meereen, as well as her tempestuous dragons. Starring Kit Harington, Lena Headey, Peter Dinklage and Emilia Clarke

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The House of Black and White

Stannis has a proposal for Jon and an advisor tempts Daenerys. Fantasy drama, starring Maisie Williams, Lena Headey and Emilia Clarke

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Queen Margaery spends time with her new husband King Tommen. Elsewhere, fugitive Tyrion and Varys walk the Long Bridge of Volantis, and in Braavos, Arya sees the Many-Faced God. Fantasy drama, starring Natalie Dormer and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The militant arm of the Faith of the Seven grows more aggressive, Jaime and Bronn head south and Ellaria and the Sand Snakes vow vengeance

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Jon enlists the help of an unexpected ally, Daenerys makes a difficult decision in Mereen, Brienne searches for Sansa, and Theon remains under Ramsays control

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Arya continues her training at the House of Black and White, Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers and the Sand Snakes mount an attack. Fantasy, starring Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Jon prepares for conflict, Sansa tries to talk to Theon, and Brienne waits for a sign. Elsewhere, Jaime attempts to reconnect with his family

programme.desc: Arya makes progress in her training, Sansa confronts an old friend, Cersei faces a struggle and Jon embarks on a journey. Fantasy drama, starring Lena Headey

Starring Kit Harington, Emilia Clarke, Lena Headey and Stephen Dillane

programme.title: The Death of Bunny Munro
programme.desc: Desperate to get back to work and escape his grief, Bunny and Junior hit the road, but while Libbys appearances provide comfort for his son, she haunts Bunny, who tries to fill the void by seducing his customers. However, the pressures of taking care of Junior leads to him repeatedly striking out. Bunnys desperation comes to a head when he leaves Junior in a hotel room to make a late-night sales call

programme.title: It: Welcome to Derry
programme.desc: After learning the truth about General Shaws operation, Leroy decides to move his family to the base for safety. While the tribal Keepers strategise how to contain increased aggression in town, the military descends on Neibolt Street, and the kids head into the sewers with their own objective.

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Jane confronts Renata when she learns a petition has been raised to exclude Ziggy, and the truth behind Abigails secret project comes out
