programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A boater jumps through a fireball after a gas explosion, a hunter has a heart attack, and fishermen get some much-needed advice

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mother and her unborn baby are at risk, adventure biking in the Marlborough Sounds causes a nasty injury, and a Land SAR team saves the day

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A head-on crash leaves two men in a critical condition, crashing a dirt bike on a remote farm ends badly for a 12-year-old, and a tourist gets the ride of her life

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A motorcyclist suffers a horrible injury, a husband performs life-saving CPR, a concussed mountain biker is found dazed and confused, and police have some VIP passengers

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: As the festive season approaches at Fitzpatrick Referrals, Professor Noel and his team treat three special patients. A one-year-old crossbreed puppy rescued by a charity from Romania is in need of complex surgery, with no guarantee of success. An eight-year-old Dalmatian needs work on its spinal cord, and a Labrador from Switzerland is having trouble walking. Noels investigations reveal problems with both shoulder and elbow, an unusual combination that requires dramatic intervention

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary focuses on everyday situations in the neonatal ward, which treats one in 10 of the babies born at the maternity hospital. Parents anxiously await news of their twins, who were born 17 weeks premature, and a couple remain positive that one of their newborn triplets will soon be able to join his two brothers at home

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 19-year-old looks forward to becoming a mother after being told she might never get pregnant. Meanwhile, a woman who is terrified of needles dreads the prospect of undergoing an epidural, and a lesbian couple prepare for the birth of their second child

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service are on hand to help a young girl who calls after her grandfather falls. The ambulance is delayed after witnessing a car crash en route

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service are called to the scene of a horrific car crash. Paramedics Mat and Patia help a man who is anxious after taking drugs

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan is outraged when Ben, ever the romantic, buys her a vacuum cleaner for Christmas, so in a desperate attempt to make amends, he gets her a necklace instead. However, when he discovers it for sale at half the price the following day, he is determined to return it and buy it again at the bargain rate - but the no-nonsense jeweller (guest star Julian Clary) is having none of it. To make matters worse, Susan turns up and the Harpers end up getting trapped in the department store overnight. Meanwhile, Janey, Michael and Alfie decide to give Susan and Ben a thoughtful present for a change, but despite their best efforts, it does not turn out quite as planned. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star in the festive special from 2008

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a 67-year-old with a lung condition who cant breathe. Plus, crews help a 53-year-old whos had several seizures

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Londons Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Partys landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of Londons most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regents Park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto Londons newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capitals air quality is monitored today

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the latest leg on the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953 the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century. In Norwich, he admires the Norman Cathedral, then traces the history of the postcode

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2, while Bubbles regrets sitting in an immaculate Morris 1800 which hes now desperate to bid on

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owners pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: War Factories

Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the citys famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the high-end removals industry in the UK, meeting the wealthy clients moving priceless objects, and the firms tasked with completing the precarious jobs. programme.desc: Anne Robinson concludes her two-part investigation into Britains spending habits, asking whether it is possible for a person to spend their way to happiness. She meets billionaire John Caudwell, one of the UKs richest men with a home worth £90million, who explains why his extraordinary personal wealth has not been able to negate the sadness in his life. Anne discovers how an inability to spend can also cause intense distress when she encounters Brian, who has fallen on hard times, and depends on a local food bank to survive. Also featured are Katie, a working mother who campaigned to have a branch of Waitrose opened near her home, and Rosie, the wife of an affluent City banker, who claims to be an ethical shopper for whom every purchase must conform to strict moral guidelines

programme.desc: An idyllic summer day in Oxford is torn asunder when a parcel bomb claims the life of eminent mathematician Adam Capstone, a genius in the field of `Knot Theory". As Lewis and Hathaway investigate, they discover that, while the victims academic reputation was beyond reproach, his private life was far more dubious. It emerges Capstone was a man of carnal appetites, who had a string of affairs with young students, betraying his chemistry professor wife Elizabeth, providing her with a clear motive to do away with her cheating spouse. As the detectives work to identify the killer bomber, the case becomes a personal challenge for Lewis, who fears he may not be rewarded with another contract should he fail to impress Moody before his six-month trip to New Zealand. programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her childrens private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. programme.desc: Following Jos assault, the team is devastated. However, the detective knows Duncans lying - perhaps not about the murder, but about something else significant. So when Duncan finally admits he had an affair with Donna, its not long before a bombshell is dropped

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Husband and wife Ben and Helen are aiming for a round-the-world trip, lifelong friends Brian and Andy want to take a nostalgic golfing holiday in style, and mother-and-daughter Shan and Babs hope to take their family to Jamaica to see their relatives

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joannas family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: The crew enjoys a day off at an exclusive beach club in Mallorca, and romance is in the air when Malias boyfriend Tom arrives for a visit. With Kiko off the boat, Captain Sandy struggles to find a suitable replacementThe crew enjoys a day off at an exclusive beach club in Mallorca, and romance is in the air when Malias boyfriend Tom arrives for a visit. With Kiko off the boat, Captain Sandy struggles to find a suitable replacement

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: Captain Sandy faces a difficult decision that could change The Wellingtons trajectory. And while Bugsy grapples with a new challenge, Malia worries about Toms ability to navigate

programme.title: The Group Chat
programme.desc: Richard Chambers, Gavan Reilly and Zara King discuss the main news stories of the week in a round-table conversation

programme.title: My Mum, Your Dad Australia
programme.desc: The Australian version of the smash-hit relationship show. The kids see more than anticipated when the remaining couples go on their final dates ahead of the Blessing Ceremony.

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the rolling jackpot, which starts at £3,000

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Chef Nathan Outlaw puts four amateur home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to fillet a fish, with the aim of choosing one to join him in the final

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Bobby Davro puts on a dinner party as he plays mystery host to four strangers, who have to try to work out his identity using cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine Show
programme.desc: All the latest from the comeptition, featuring highlights and interviews

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as all eight remaining singers take to the stage and compete to remain anonymous. Panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and Mo Gilligan choose a fifth celebrity to be eliminated and unmasked

programme.title: The Mike Tomlin Show
programme.desc: Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin offers insider insights, game previews and candid commentary

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Ros, Joshua, Steve and Zara vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Signal problems lead to a restricted service during rush hour, which causes severe congestion at the station and the same equipment causes more grief 24 hours later - leading to the complete suspension of the line. Jonny and his team of engineers are replacing a 60ft section of rail as one of the clamps holding it in place has weakened, but they have just four hours to complete the complex task before the morning rush begins

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of a regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: Scott Mills, Gareth Malone, Louise Minchin and Glenn Hoddle
programme.desc: Scott Mills, Gareth Malone, Louise Minchin and Glenn Hoddle must pit their wits against the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius determined to stop them winning the cash prize. Hosted by Bradley Walsh

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the best of British ingredients, beginning with a delicious brunch of poached eggs, asparagus and hollandaise sauce, and a side dish of layered potatoes and onions with baked Tunworth cheese. John then makes steamed mussels with Cornish cider and bacon served alongside Lisas simple soda bread, and she creates a strawberry mousse cake for dessert

programme.title: Hells Kitchen
programme.desc: The top five try to make professional chefs out of comedians including Druski, Jeff Dye, Judy Gold and Yamaneika Saunders.

programme.title: Generation Dating
programme.desc: Two strangers with a substantial age gap are brought together, and each is challenged to find a suitable date for the other

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Documentary following a major construction project at Claridges, revealing the engineering challenges involved in digging out a five-storey basement, adding four new floors to the top of the hotel and creating Londons most expensive penthouse. In the first edition, Donegal miners work 24 hours a day to tunnel under the hotel by hand, while hotel manager Eugene tries hard to ensure loyal guests like David Walliams, Christian Louboutin and Damien Hirst remain undisturbed by the work going on above and below them

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: Maya Jama presents as previous contestants return to the villa in the hope of finding romance the second time around, with Iain Stirling narrating proceedings. Maya will be there from the start to give everyone a shoulder to cry on. Who will find love, who will turn heads, and who will be the winning couple?

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Jodie Foster discusses her role in the latest season of TV drama True Detective: Night Country, Oscar-winner Olivia Colman talks about her new mystery comedy Wicked Little Letters, while US comedy great Wanda Sykes reflects on her Netflix special Im an Entertainer. Plus, doyenne of daytime TV Lorraine Kelly discusses her debut novel The Island Swimmer and Austin Butler and Josh Brolin discuss new sci-fi epic Dune: Part Two. Calvin Harris and RagnBone Man deliver a world exclusive performance of their new single Lovers in a Past Life
